metadata.title: CVE-2021-38208 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
net/nfc/llcp_sock.c in the Linux kernel before 5.12.10 allows localunprivileged users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereferenceand BUG) by making a getsockname call after a certain type of failure of abind call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-81-generic - 5.4.0-81.91
linux-image-5.4.0-81-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-81.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-81-generic - 5.4.0-81.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-81-lowlatency - 5.4.0-81.91
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1045-kvm - 5.4.0-1045.47
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-81.91').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11, was pending').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1045.47').
